nl.inl.blacklab.search

Class Hits

  • java.lang.Object
    • nl.inl.blacklab.search.Hits
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<Hit>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    HitsWindow

    public class Hits
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Iterable<Hit>
    Represents a list of Hit objects. Also maintains information about the context (concordance) information stored in the Hit objects.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected java.lang.String concordanceFieldName
      The default field to use for retrieving concordance information.
      protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> contextFieldsPropName
      If we have context information, this specifies the property (i.e. word, lemma, pos) the context came from.
      protected java.util.List<Hit> hits
      The hits.
      protected java.util.Map<Hit,Kwic> kwics
      The KWIC data, if it has been retrieved.
      protected static org.apache.log4j.Logger logger 
      protected Searcher searcher
      The searcher object.
      protected BLSpans sourceSpans
      Our Spans object, which may not have been fully read yet.
      protected boolean sourceSpansFullyRead
      Did we completely read our Spans object?

      • kwics

        protected java.util.Map<Hit,Kwic> kwics
        The KWIC data, if it has been retrieved. NOTE: this will always be null if not all the hits have been retrieved.

        The searcher object.

      • contextFieldsPropName

        protected java.util.List<java.lang.String> contextFieldsPropName
        If we have context information, this specifies the property (i.e. word, lemma, pos) the context came from. Otherwise, it is null.

        @Deprecated
public Hits(Searcher searcher,
               java.lang.String concordanceFieldPropName,
               org.apache.lucene.search.spans.Spans source)
        Deprecated. supply a SpanQuery to a Hits object instead
        Construct an empty Hits object. If possible, don't use this constructor, use the one that takes a SpanQuery, as it's more efficient.
        Parameters:
        searcher - the searcher object
        concordanceFieldPropName - field to use by default when finding concordances
        source - where to retrieve the Hit objects from

        sourceQuery - the query to execute to get the hits

        org.apache.lucene.search.BooleanQuery.TooManyClauses - if the query is overly broad (expands to too many terms)

      • tooManyHits

        @Deprecated
public boolean tooManyHits()
        Deprecated. renamed to maxHitsRetrieved()
        Were all hits retrieved, or did we stop because there were too many?
        Returns:
        true if all hits were retrieved

      • maxHitsRetrieved

        public boolean maxHitsRetrieved()
        Did we stop retrieving hits because we reached the maximum?
        Returns:
        true if we reached the maximum and stopped retrieving hits

      • maxHitsCounted

        public boolean maxHitsCounted()
        Did we stop counting hits because we reached the maximum?
        Returns:
        true if we reached the maximum and stopped counting hits

      • getHits

        @Deprecated
public java.util.List<Hit> getHits()
        Deprecated. Breaks optimizations. Use iteration or window() instead.
        Get the list of hits.
        Returns:
        the list of hits

      • sort

        @Deprecated
public void sort(HitProperty[] sortProp,
                   boolean reverseSort)
        Deprecated. use single HitProperty version, possibly with HitPropertyMultiple
        Sort the list of hits. Note that if the thread is interrupted during this, sort may return without the hits actually being fully read and sorted. We don't want to add throws declarations to our whole API, so we assume the calling method will check for thread interruption if the application uses it.
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the hit property/properties to sort on
        reverseSort - if true, sort in descending order

      • sort

        @Deprecated
public void sort(HitProperty... sortProp)
        Deprecated. use single HitProperty version, possibly with HitPropertyMultiple
        Sort the list of hits. Note that if the thread is interrupted during this, sort may return without the hits actually being fully read and sorted. We don't want to add throws declarations to our whole API, so we assume the calling method will check for thread interruption if the application uses it.
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the hit property/properties to sort on

      • sort

        public void sort(HitProperty sortProp)
        Sort the list of hits. Note that if the thread is interrupted during this, sort may return without the hits actually being fully read and sorted. We don't want to add throws declarations to our whole API, so we assume the calling method will check for thread interruption if the application uses it.
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the hit property to sort on

      • sort

        public void sort(HitProperty sortProp,
        boolean reverseSort)
        Sort the list of hits. Note that if the thread is interrupted during this, sort may return without the hits actually being fully read and sorted. We don't want to add throws declarations to our whole API, so we assume the calling method will check for thread interruption if the application uses it. Case-sensitivity depends on the default case-sensitivity set on the Searcher object.
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the hit property to sort on
        reverseSort - if true, sort in descending order

      • sort

        public void sort(HitProperty sortProp,
        boolean reverseSort,
        boolean sensitive)
        Sort the list of hits. Note that if the thread is interrupted during this, sort may return without the hits actually being fully read and sorted. We don't want to add throws declarations to our whole API, so we assume the calling method will check for thread interruption if the application uses it.
        Parameters:
        sortProp - the hit property to sort on
        reverseSort - if true, sort in descending order
        sensitive - whether to sort case-sensitively or not

      • add

        public void add(Hit hit)
        Add a hit to the list
        Parameters:
        hit - the hit

      • sizeAtLeast

        public boolean sizeAtLeast(int lowerBound)
        Determines if there are at least a certain number of hits This may be used if we don't want to process all hits (which may be a lot) but we do need to know something about the size of the result set (such as for paging). Note that this method applies to the hits retrieved, which may be less than the total number of hits (depending on maxHitsToRetrieve).
        Parameters:
        lowerBound - the number we're testing against
        Returns:
        true if the size of this set is at least lowerBound, false otherwise.

      • size

        public int size()
        Return the number of hits available. Note that this method applies to the hits retrieved, which may be less than the total number of hits (depending on maxHitsToRetrieve). Use totalSize() to find the total hit count (which may also be limited depending on maxHitsToCount).
        Returns:
        the number of hits available

      • totalSize

        public int totalSize()
        Return the total number of hits. NOTE: Depending on maxHitsToRetrieve, hit retrieval may stop before all hits are seen. We do keep counting hits though (until we reach maxHitsToCount, or that value is negative). This method returns our total hit count. Some of these hits may not be available.
        Returns:
        the total hit count

      • numberOfDocs

        public int numberOfDocs()
        Return the number of documents in the hits we've retrieved.
        Returns:
        the number of documents.

      • totalNumberOfDocs

        public int totalNumberOfDocs()
        Return the total number of documents in all hits. This counts documents even in hits that are not stored, only counted.
        Returns:
        the total number of documents.

      • countSoFarHitsCounted

        public int countSoFarHitsCounted()
        Return the number of hits counted so far. If you're retrieving hit in a background thread, call this method from another thread to get an update of the count so far.
        Returns:
        the current total hit count

      • countSoFarHitsRetrieved

        public int countSoFarHitsRetrieved()
        Return the number of hits retrieved so far. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to get an update of the count so far.
        Returns:
        the current total hit count

      • countSoFarDocsCounted

        public int countSoFarDocsCounted()
        Return the number of documents counted so far. If you're retrieving hit in a background thread, call this method from another thread to get an update of the count so far.
        Returns:
        the current total hit count

      • countSoFarDocsRetrieved

        public int countSoFarDocsRetrieved()
        Return the number of documents retrieved so far. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to get an update of the count so far.
        Returns:
        the current total hit count

      • doneFetchingHits

        public boolean doneFetchingHits()
        Check if we're done retrieving/counting hits. If you're retrieving hits in a background thread, call this method from another thread to check if all hits have been processed.
        Returns:
        true iff all hits have been retrieved/counted.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<Hit> iterator()
        Return an iterator over these hits.
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<Hit>
        Returns:
        the iterator

      • get

        public Hit get(int i)
        Return the specified hit.
        Parameters:
        i - index of the desired hit
        Returns:
        the hit, or null if it's beyond the last hit

      • getConcordance

        public Concordance getConcordance(Hit h)
        Return the concordance for the specified hit. The first call to this method will fetch the concordances for all the hits in this Hits object. So make sure to select an appropriate HitsWindow first: don't call this method on a Hits set with >1M hits unless you really want to display all of them in one go.
        Parameters:
        h - the hit
        Returns:
        concordance for this hit

      • getKwic

        public Kwic getKwic(Hit h)
        Return the KWIC for the specified hit. The first call to this method will fetch the KWICs for all the hits in this Hits object. So make sure to select an appropriate HitsWindow first: don't call this method on a Hits set with >1M hits unless you really want to display all of them in one go.
        Parameters:
        h - the hit
        Returns:
        KWIC for this hit

      • getConcordance

        public Concordance getConcordance(java.lang.String fieldName,
                         Hit hit,
                         int contextSize)
        Retrieve a single concordance. Only use if you need a larger snippet around a single hit. If you need concordances for a set of hits, just instantiate a HitsWindow and call getConcordance() on that; it will fetch all concordances in the window in a batch, which is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field to use for building the concordance
        hit - the hit for which we want a concordance
        contextSize - the desired number of words around the hit
        Returns:
        the concordance

      • getKwic

        public Kwic getKwic(java.lang.String fieldName,
           Hit hit,
           int contextSize)
        Retrieve a single KWIC (KeyWord In Context). Only use if you need a larger snippet around a single hit. If you need KWICs for a set of hits, just instantiate a HitsWindow and call getKwic() on that; it will fetch all KWICs in the window in a batch, which is more efficient.
        Parameters:
        fieldName - field to use for building the KWIC
        hit - the hit for which we want a KWIC
        contextSize - the desired number of words around the hit
        Returns:
        the KWIC

      • getConcordance

        public Concordance getConcordance(Hit h,
                         int contextSize)
        Get a concordance with a custom context size. Don't call this directly for displaying a list of results. In that case, just instantiate a HitsWindow, call setContextSize() on it to set a default context size and call getConcordance(Hit) for each hit. That's more efficient if you're dealing with many hits. This method is mostly just for getting a larger snippet around a single hit.
        Parameters:
        h - the hit
        contextSize - the context size for this concordance (only use if you want a different one than the preset preference)
        Returns:
        concordance for this hit

      • getKwic

        public Kwic getKwic(Hit h,
           int contextSize)
        Get a KWIC with a custom context size. Don't call this directly for displaying a list of results. In that case, just instantiate a HitsWindow, call setContextSize() on it to set a default context size and call getKwic(Hit) for each hit. That's more efficient if you're dealing with many hits. This method is mostly just for getting a larger snippet around a single hit.
        Parameters:
        h - the hit
        contextSize - the context size for this KWIC (only use if you want a different one than the preset preference)
        Returns:
        KWIC for this hit

      • findContext

        public void findContext(java.util.List<java.lang.String> fieldProps)
        Retrieve context words for the hits.
        Parameters:
        fieldProps - the field and properties to use for the context

      • clearConcordances

        public void clearConcordances()
        Clear any cached concordances so new ones will be created on next call to getConcordance().

      • clearContext

        @Deprecated
public void clearContext()
        Deprecated. not used, and not the client's concern
        Clear any cached context so new one will be retrieved when necessary.

      • getCollocations

        public TokenFrequencyList getCollocations()
        Count occurrences of context words around hit. Uses the default contents field for collocations.
        Returns:
        the frequency of each occurring token

      • getCollocations

        public TokenFrequencyList getCollocations(java.lang.String propName,
                                 QueryExecutionContext ctx)
        Count occurrences of context words around hit.
        Parameters:
        propName - the property to use for the collocations, or null if default
        ctx - query execution context, containing the sensitivity settings
        Returns:
        the frequency of each occurring token

      • subList

        @Deprecated
public java.util.List<Hit> subList(int fromIndex,
                                     int toIndex)
        Deprecated. use window()
        Retrieve a sublist of hits. If toIndex is beyond the last hit, will return a list up to and including the last hit.
        Parameters:
        fromIndex - first hit to include in the resulting list
        toIndex - first hit not to include in the resulting list
        Returns:
        the sublist

      • window

        public HitsWindow window(int first,
                int windowSize)
        Get a window into this list of hits. Use this if you're displaying part of the resultset, like in a paging interface. It makes sure BlackLab only works with the hits you want to display and doesn't do any unnecessary processing on the other hits. HitsWindow includes methods to assist with paging, like figuring out if there hits before or after the window.
        Parameters:
        first - first hit in the window (0-based)
        windowSize - size of the window
        Returns:
        the window

      • setContextField

        public void setContextField(java.util.List<java.lang.String> contextField)
        Set the field properties to retrieve context from
        Parameters:
        contextField - the field properties

        the default maximum number of hits to retrieve.

        public static void setDefaultMaxHitsToRetrieve(int n)
        Set the default maximum number of hits to retrieve
        Parameters:
